label: Mathematical Economics
description: Introduction to game theory with applications to economics; emphasizes the analysis of static and dynamic games with or without complete information. 3 undergraduate hours. 2 or 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: One of MATH 125, MATH 225, MATH 415; MATH 241 or equivalent; ECON 302.
courseSectionInformation: 3 undergraduate hours. 2 or 4 graduate hours. Prerequisite: One of MATH 125, MATH 225, MATH 415; MATH 241 or equivalent; ECON 302.
sectionDeptRestriction: Restricted to students in the Economics department.
